page.title: 11WHEN THE WHISTLE GOES...
page.content: When the whistle goes we go into school and the teacher calls the register. The whole school goes into the hall for assembly. We say prayers, sing hymns and get the notices for the day. After assembly we go back into our classrooms for our lessons.These consist of maths, language, poetry, handwriting practice, spelling, topic work, P.E., games, drama, country dancing, art, model making, music, quiet reading or personal investigation in the school library. At lunchtime we have a choice of school dinners or sandwiches and then go out to play. During the afternoon session we practised our school play for the end of term.At 3:15 we put our chairs up on our tables for the end of the school day.
